title: 440-B
statement: B. Balancertime limit per test0.5 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutPetya haskmatches, placed innmatchboxes lying in a line from left to right. We know thatkis divisible byn. Petya wants all boxes to have the same number of matches inside. For that, he can move a match from its box to the adjacent one in one move. How many such moves does he need to achieve the desired configuration?InputThe first line contains integern(1 ≤n≤ 50000). processed.result: You are given $n$ boxes containing matches. The number of matches in each box is given as a list of $n$ non-negative integers. The total number of matches is divisible by $n$. You can move one match from one box to an adjacent box in one move. What is the minimum number of moves required to make the number of matches in each box equal?

You are given a line of boxes, each containing a number of items. You need to divide the items equally among the boxes.  You can move one item from one box to an adjacent box at a time. What is the minimum number of moves required to achieve an equal distribution?
